reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to enjoy a relaxing break on Crete, this would be very hard to beat. Panormo is a small and largely unspoilt fishing village, with a nice beach and a good selection of restaurants, cafes and bars. And Villa Kynthia, which has been beautifully restored by a welcoming sister/brother team, is an absolute delight. We had the middle-sized room of the five (Pandora) and that was quite spacious, so the bigger ones must be enormous. The small pool was very welcome on hot days. And breakfasts in the courtyard, under a spreading pine tree, made a perfect start to each day.
reviews.title: A delightful guest house in a lovely village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Kynthia is in the centre of Panormos, a fairly quiet seaside village. It's small, only 6 rooms, and has been beautifully restored. We stayed in Odyssey suite, which was about 20' square, 4 poster bed, with separate en-suite set off of a tiny lobby. It has a balcony with small table & 2 chairs that overlooks the street which is reasonably quiet, but beware of the refuse truck that arrives when it's still dark! The best thing about the villa is the courtyard, an oasis of peace & quiet where most guests congregated at the end of the evening without intruding on their fellow guests. It is not a hotel - the reception is not manned, but a lovely greek lady serves the breakfast each morning between 8.30 & 10.00, & is there to serve ouzo, wine etc from 20.00-22.00 in the evening, but as long as you understand it's a guest house, this isn't really a problem.
reviews.title: Very good guest house - not a hotel

reviews.text: Villa Kynthia is a renovated Villa, perfect to have relaxing holidays, a magical environment, that makes you feel like home! This was the third time we've chose Villa Kynthia for our vacations. Kynthia's rooms have a very unique character and each one is completely different. You will have a good perspective if you see some photos from the yard & the rooms.
reviews.title: Magical, Inspirational....really good to relax
Friendly, Full of character, tranquil but not isolated. Perfect
reviews.text: Is located in Panormo Village which is a perfect location if you love Crete Island. Warm people that they really love their village & they try to keep the original character of the village.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place! It is a gem, offering the perfect mix of small, friendly, non corporate, characterful, with pool, in the heart of a quiet, relaxed village/ small town with plenty of tavernas and no here we go element. villa kynthia has such a pretty private courtyard for breakfast and enjoying while lazing by the pool. We also had pre dinner drinks there each night which were reasonably priced and delicious, it meant we could enjoy the place in the evening too. The welcome and service was spot on from emails before arrival throughout. We took the smallest room and it was modest but pretty and the bathroom being over the hall was never a problem. Only thing is the bed was so hard it was uncomfortable. We stayed at a second hotel in Crete during this trip and that bed was the same so maybe that's how they are in Crete? A definite downer for us but that's subjective. I have not given it full marks for value because i think it is expensive for a relatively simple place, particularly given our room was not luxurious. But, that said, i did love it and will pay more for such a nice pace. Both villa kynthia and panormos are highly recommended by me! We thought the village was a lovely spot for families as the beaches were small and felt safe. We went in late June and it was pretty quiet - all v relaxed and friendly.
reviews.title: Gem of a place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely hotel has the feel of an intimate country b&b, a feeling that is backed up by the warmth and friendliness of its owners, Korinna and Andonis. We stayed in 'Artemis', a large double room, running the rear width of the house. You'll find the room very well appointed with lovely antique furniture including a beautiful 4 poster bed and dressing table. Ample storage is provided by a large wardrobe and chest of drawers as well as bedside tables and the walls are decked with artful pictures. Persian rugs part cover the polished wooden floor and a stylish room divider separates the sleeping area from a good sized sitting and dressing space. The 4 piece en-suite bathroom is stylishly black and white tiled and there is room enough to swing not one, but two cats. It could be updated but that would somehow seem rude, it works and works well.
reviews.title: Peaceful and charming. A delight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three good sized windows with solid wood Mediterranean blue shutters which can be fully opened, overlook a most delightful courtyard garden and raised pool area. The paving features patterned inserts and is dotted with terracotta pots of various shapes and sizes, creating a traditional country feel. There is no shortage of greenery either; two imperious trees cast a wonderful dappled light which is ideal if, at times you need to shelter from the heat of the sun. Sun worshippers on the other hand, will find they are drawn to the pool area. A good number of sun loungers, chairs and tables are arranged poolside with umbrellas, should you wish to use them.
reviews.title: Pretty house, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked villa kynthia not wanting a big, chain hotel and also thinking panormo would have been quite characteristic for a few days in crete. The house is attractive, with spacious, clean rooms: our first night was in Rea which is good for a family. It's a bit dark, but very comfortable with all mod cons, and a small, a bit tired, bathroom. The 3 other nights we stayed in our first choice, Pandora on the first floor which is perfect for a couple. It has a private small terrace with sun loungers (in shade in the afternoon) and a lot of room. The bathroom is also quite tired and a bit smelly (damp/drain). The ground floor terraced area is very pleasant to have breakfast and relax except that when we were there there were two extremely rude British families with demonic young children who run around screaming and throwing things at all times, making relaxing in this nice outdoor area impossible. This is definitely not a place for small children!
reviews.title: Relaxing, authentic, warm & friendly in Crete

reviews.text: Breakfast is fresh and has everything one could wish for, almost: fresh fruit, cereals, biscuits, cakes, cold cuts, Greek yogurt. Unfortunately it wasn't the best breakfast around, I'd have liked some toast or something more 'continetnal' and maybe being told what was on offer. We saw eggs being prepared by the very helpful waitress but we were never offered a choice. Corinna, the owner, is absolutely lovely and very frendly and helpful pointing us towards things to visit and places to eat. She definitely adds to the charme of Villa kynthia and makes you feel very welcome. The village of Panormo is ok, not the most attractive but it has a couple of nice tavernas and one nice bar where to watch the sunset with a G&T in hand. Parking is free right behind the house, which is very well located in the village itself.
reviews.title: Charming, characterful and welcoming.
